website_summaries.verdict: A reliable computer that works well for beginners.
pros: This wired speed sensor computer tracks speed and distance
Will stop calculating time and speed when at rest
Large display is easy to read
cons: Mounting the sensor is difficult due to the short wire

customer_reviews.title: Too easy to use
customer_reviews.text: If all you need are the basics and something that takes about 10 minutes to install then buy this right now. The setup was easy and the one button feature is a blessing. I've been riding for decades and am so over the mega-multi function monster that takes an I.T. wiz kid to program. This one had me at hello.....
customer_reviews.author: John H. Taylor Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Possibly Quality Control Problems.
customer_reviews.text: I like the layout of this Bike Computer. But mine was defective, almost immediately. The display stopped showing specific segments, that make up the numbers, on my first Ride, after installing it. Look at the included picture, taken around after mile 21 or so. I think I was doing 5.5 mph. Or was it 6.5? No way to tell. It's being returned. Now I have to decide if I roll the dice again, in hopes I won't get another defective one? Or do I look to other Brands/Models. Too bad. Because the Features are nice; the Display is large; And it installed easily, for me (Mechanical Engineer).
customer_reviews.author: Aces

customer_reviews.title: Best Bicycle Speed and Trip Computer
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to mount and set up when following directions. The numbers are large and easy to read while riding your bike. It has all the functions a novice or semi serious rider would need. When we go for a ride we get our riding time, distance, average speed, maximum speed, real time speedometer, has a clock, and maintains an odometer for bike miles. Except for the clock and odometer you may reset everything else for a new ride. This device is easy to use and would recommend it to anyone who enjoys riding a bicycle. It is priced very reasonable. Have had this product for three months with no problems. A must have and a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work once after installed, then never worked again
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my bike for a 30 miles bike ride with the people I bike with. It worked after installed throughout the first ride. Due to weather we did not get out for over a month for another ride and the Cat Eye did not work at all. Gave me the time but did not recognize the movement of the bike at all. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. Since I did not get to the second time of using this device till after the 30 day return period was over I cannot return it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: TEJ

customer_reviews.title: Not too complicated
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted an odometer and a speedometer. This CAT EYE - Velo 7 Bike Computer does just that as well as a few other things. All in all the wired version that I bought was a piece of cake to install and seems to be working flawlessly so far. The whole thing is just very easy to install and use. Not a lot of complicated menus or programming.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: The display is accurate and easy to read. Setup was a little difficult, the menu could be a little simpler. I left my bike out in the rain and it didn't damage the speedometer. I also goes into low-power mode if it's not being used. I took the extra time to do the more accurate setup, and the speeds and distances agree very closely with GPS. The two reasons I gave it 4 stars: 1. The wire that connects to the wheel rotation sensor is short, so you have to use the front wheel. 2. The menu setup was a little tricky. These are minor issues and wouldn't stop me from recommending it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I live in the North East, so I don't ride once the snow falls. Bought this in September, and it worked fine until I stored the bike for the winter. Finally got around to look for the issue today, and no luck. The sensor is in the appropriate position. I changed the battery. I checked the wire for damage, none found. Still only tells me the time. Since I wear a watch, not much help there. I'll look for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Our Favorite Bike Computer
customer_reviews.text: We have used several different types of bike computers, but this had been the best that we've found for our purposes. At first we mostly just wanted to have something reliable that would show how far we rode and how long it took, but after a while, we also learned to appreciate some of the other features, like average speed and top speed, etc. This is a quality built product and has lasted my wife through three bikes as she progress up the scale of bikes, and is still serving its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Tim C

customer_reviews.title: Setup instructions are misleading, leading to frustration/disappointment
customer_reviews.text: You can buy cheaper wired odometers, but I bought this model in the hope that it would work reliably for 2 or 3 years. The instructions have you set mph/kph, press set, set tire size, press set, set 12/24 hr clock. Most people naturally press set at this point, to move on to set the time. WRONG! You have to hold down the mode button for 3 secs to be able to set the time. The set up is inconsistent, and I was about to return the product until I noticed some good advice here. Cateye either needs to fix the poor UX design, or improve their instructions to warn people of this inconsistency in setting.
customer_reviews.author: Peter vdL.

customer_reviews.title: Lower end but good
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to set up, sadly you are pretty much what they give you for tires, no changes until you get to 700. Checked with a GPS (iPhone) and they pretty much agree at low mileage, 3.5 miles, two days in a row. I chose the wired version, less fussing with batteries on the transmitter. Auto shutoff is a nice feature, resetting is a touch funky but you get use to it, you have to toggle all the way down then hold the button. You keep your total mileage. Oh, I put this one on my granddaughters 24" Specialized Rockhopper. They don't give you any spare zip ties so be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Boris Badenov

customer_reviews.title: GREAT, except
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much does what it says, except I've been unable to clear the 'distance' function so that it STAYS clear. I zero it out and it reads zero, but when I get back from my ride, the mileage obviously contains the previous mileage in the total. I thought I was forgetting to zero it, so didn't try to return it or anything. And possibly that is the only glitch, but it is the main reason I bought it, was for distance on my electric scooter so I don't go past the scooter's range. Anyway, check out the item before the return window closes. It has a lot of functions that can help you or mess up.
customer_reviews.author: chris g Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and easy to read
customer_reviews.text: The installation was very simple and took me about 10 minutes or less. The information is very helpful and easy to read. The only thing is that there is no light, so you won't be able to see it at night. I solved this by hitting a head light I wear pointed down towards the computer and that has worked great. It seems very accurate as well. I use strava on my watch and when I finish each ride, the distance has been within .05 miles so far and the average speed has been extremely close as well. I just started getting into biking so for me this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Calvini

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For What I Need
customer_reviews.text: I don't ask a lot of my bike computers, but my last one (a wireless Rainiaco) still didn't measure up. The speed measurements were bizarre (measured in increments of .2 or .3mph rather than .1), the signal sometimes dropped out, and the battery always died. The CatEye has so far had none of those problems. The setup was easy, the calculations seem accurate, and I don't feel the need to constantly stare at the screen to make sure it's working. Terrific product.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and very reliable. I've been riding several times per week with this unit now for about 5 months and have observed very good accuracy and dependability. I tried a couple wireless units but had frustrating performance and reliability problems with both. Returning to the simpler wired unit has resolved all that nonsense. I heartily recommend this unit as it has all the functions that I want (plus a few that I don't use much) and it always works! Don't overspend on fancy wireless units that most of us do not need.
customer_reviews.author: 210 Driver

customer_reviews.title: Zip ties connection of the computer is a weak point
customer_reviews.text: This computer is straightforward to install, easy to read, and is smart about things like stopping the trip timer when you are not moving. However, the zip tie connection of the computer to the handlebars is a weak point in this computer. A month after installing it one of the ties stripped and came off Cat Eye wants $6 for a 10-pack; that is 20% of what I paid for the entire computer. It is a disappointment that could have been easily remedied if more zip ties had been provided. As it is, I am without a computer until I buy replacement ties. My previous computer had a screw clamp which worked for 15 years.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Tarsa

customer_reviews.title: Works but has terrible mounting hardware
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a Cateye device on every bike I had growing up through my 20s (when my phone became a GPS). My younger kids wanted these. The device works well is pretty accurate and easy to use. However the mounting hardware sucks. These devices used to come with hard plastic brackets, screws, and a thick silicon strip that would allow the brackets to secure on to any bike. These came with mounting tape and zip ties. They constantly needed to be readjusted and eventually became useless. Sent them back
customer_reviews.author: J ED

customer_reviews.title: Nice options
customer_reviews.text: This was pretty easy to install and the varied settings are helpful. I think there is some wiggle room for where you put the sensor on the wheel as to how accurately it measure speed and distance. I use this in addition to my iPhone and cadence sensor to monitor speed and distance; it seems to track a bit faster and further than the GPS in the phone. I tend to have this display speed and the time so the phone can do the HR, cadence, and overall distance. It's much easier to watch the time on this than the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Mikejrod

customer_reviews.title: reliable!
customer_reviews.text: I have a wireless computer on my other bike and I like this one far better! The wire I could do without but I like very much that it only requires one battery and so far has not lost connection. My wireless needs the sensors to be readjusted often and it requires 3 batteries, two of which have no way to tell if the battery is good or not so I end up replacing all three just to keep working proper. Will get rid of it and I bought two. (expensive mistake!)
customer_reviews.author: K. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: great product, works fantastic !
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my ebike as an alternative to an LCD screen, i have the led readout, but it only shows battery strength, so i bought this to see how fast i was going.....it does alot more than that, keeps all the stats i needed and the magnet on the spoke holds well under high rpm, i have a 26 in fat tire that is going 35mph plus and it works great !!!! really easy to install, comes with instructions, get a magnifying glass to read it lol A ++++++
customer_reviews.author: mark conner

customer_reviews.title: A Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the CAT EYE - Velo 7 for my young next-door neighbor. It replaces the broken Speedometer/Odometer that I gave to him before. I am glad that the old one broke because it was too complicated to use ... too many bells and whistles with easy access to the settings. Thankfully, the Velo 7 has the settings recessed in it's backside, and is equipped with just basic features. The user now is able to get more enjoyment out of his Speedometer/Odometer. Would have been nice to have an on/off buttoned back-light.
customer_reviews.author: LarryC

customer_reviews.title: simple,  works
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something with wired connection due to all the issues wireless models have with interference. The instructions were not that good but the results worked and it's mileage calculation matches almost exactly with Strava. I like that it can be easily removed to avoid theft or weathering.
customer_reviews.author: slammer

customer_reviews.title: If you dont mind the small display,  it's a great product.
customer_reviews.text: I pretty much love everything about the cat eye. My husband installed it quickly it looks good on my 18 inch solid wheel spin bike. The only drawback for me is the dimness of the already small display. I need my reading glasses near me at all time to see information on the display. Info seems accurate and it makes my workouts more productive now.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK! DON'T buy!
customer_reviews.text: I finally took the time to put this product on my bike and it doesn't work! I've changed batteries, messed with settings (based on the terrible directions provided) and nothing works. Has power, but won't show speed. My husband is very handy with bikes, has installed lots of these in the past, and this one simply doesn't work. Frustrated at myself for not putting it on my bike sooner so I would know that it didn't work and could return in the timeframe provided!
customer_reviews.author: Auburn E Ellingson

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, great product, terrible instructions
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and I had plenty of cable to set this up on my rear wheel. I'm using a trainer so that was a necessity. It even came with more cable ties than I needed. The screen is fairly easy to set up, and you can set the time in 12 or 24 hour format. You can also set the system to miles or kilometers. The instrutctions are pretty much garbage, but there are some great how-to videos on the internet that will walk you through it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Wire may not be long enough
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this on a trainer, so the rear wheel has the sensor. Wire is barely long enough to reach from rear fork to midway along the top frame bar. Still works, but not ideal. Also, the magnet (on the spoke) and the sensor (on the fork) need to be SUPER close to read each other. I had to add a shim to the sensor, just FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Andre C. Klein

customer_reviews.title: Works better than another computer I tried
customer_reviews.text: The sensor is small and easy to fit on a bike. It's pretty accurate - I think my only issues are that I probably chose the wrong tire size and just need to adjust that. It does have a wire but it wasn't hard to tape that to my bike and not think about it again. I tried another computer that didn't work, but this one so far works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits my need
customer_reviews.text: I have my bike up on trainer, but needed a speedometer that would work on the rear wheel and this fit the bill. I did, however, have to do a few modifications. For one, I attached a piece of plastic to the frame (opposite the chain side) so the sensor would be closer to the rear rim; and also cut and added some wiring so it would reach to the handle bars. After completing all of the above, it's working exactly as it should. Please note: if you decide to cut the wire as I did, pretty sure the item cannot be returned for a credit or exchange.
customer_reviews.author: wilfig12

customer_reviews.title: Great bike computer!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent basic bike computer. If you need basic information (speed, ride time, distance, time of day, max speed plus a few others) this is the computer for you. Installation was a little wonky but once you get used to the instruction sheet, it's quite easy. From start to finish, setup and install took me about 15 minutes. The readout on the computer is large and bold and the various measurements are easily sequenced via touching the single button repeatedly. Final word: you'd be hard-pressed to find a better basic bike computer.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I like this computer very much
customer_reviews.text: I like this computer very much. It is clear, accurate, and easy to operate. I appreciate the fact that it is very reliable because I've had it with the wireless ones that blink and give you readings up and down the scale. All that hassle with the wireless computer is just to avoid connecting them with a foot-long wire. It is a relief to have such a hassle-free computer.
customer_reviews.author: K.I.

customer_reviews.title: Updated: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This speedo worked well for about 2 & 1/2 weeks and then I went for a ride after which it just doesn't register the speed anymore. I've checked to see for any signs of broken wires or if anything else was broken but everything is in good condition. Update: make sure to tighten the zipties included and to have the magnet within the detection zone. After rechecking I realized that the sensor must have shimied down and the magnet was no longer being registered. After fixing this problem it works well again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cateye has gone downhill
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 older Cateye speedometers/computers. They are great so I thought I would buy the Velo 7. They have cheapened them so much. You can no longer set your wheel size exactly by cm. You get to choose 700C or 26". They no longer have a screwdown clamp for the speedometer. You zip tie it on - CHEAP. The plastic slots that the zip ties go through are not going to last without cracking. My next speedometer will not be a Cateye. You can get better ones for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cyclist

customer_reviews.title: Basic, works fine!
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic, no frills, old school (wired!) bike computer. I think the trend towards wireless is over-rated. This computer works fine. You do need to run the wiring and make sure you have enough leeway when you turn the handlebar fully, but as long as you're careful, not a big deal. I would love it if it had 2 "trip distance" functions. This way, say you go on a week long trip, you can track your daily mileage AND the total distance for the week, but that's being picky. The old wired Strada had 2 trip distances:-)
customer_reviews.author: RanMan

customer_reviews.title: Rated for foul weather!
customer_reviews.text: OK. It was not smart to finish the last 18 miles of my last ride in a driving rain. Traction (mine and the opposition's), visibility (mine and the opposition's), and hypothermia concerns should not have been accepted so cavalierly. But I beg to report that my 7 year old Cat Eye ran like a champ the whole time, and still does (unlike its unnamed predecessor)!
customer_reviews.author: P. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Simple - Easy to Read - Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, simple, easy to read, and inexpensive computer for the bike. Nothing fancy but I don't need anything fancy! I did use a couple extra zip ties of my own to make (what I think) the cable a little more secure and out of the way. But that's more my OCD than any fault with the number of zip ties they provide. I think every bike should just come with one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Rock

customer_reviews.title: Works on Stationary Bike!  Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our stationary bike with a solid tire. I had to create my own "spoke" with about 6" of 16g copper wire. I threaded the magnet onto the wire and then duct taped the wire to the wheel. The wire allowed me to adjust the depth from the wheel to get within the minimum 5mm of the sensor. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Hazelnus

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The Cateye Velo 7 does what it claims to do ... present limited, simple information in a reliable, intuitive manner. I have an ebike, thus to eliminate the possibility of electromagnetic interference, choose the wired option. My previous Cateye was wireless and simply stopped working when the ebike upgrade was installed. Works great after ~200 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice affordable cyclocomputer, great value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, works great. It's a bit confusing to get the right sequence of button presses for all the setup features, but I think that is true of any device with so many functions and so few buttons. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a quality affordable computer for their bike. These computers can be adapted to motorcycles as well.
customer_reviews.author: gus-man

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed for an extended tour
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this late in the cycling season, but I was able to get a few rides in before the weather turned too cold for my liking. Installation was a breeze on my 94 GT Discovery hybrid with 700C rims. The main purpose for getting this is for an upcoming 2,500 mile bicycle tour/fundraiser. I need it to keep fundraiser miles separate from a week and a half of added personal miles. Being 50 years old, it was easy enough to read and use. Wasn’t looking for loads of bells and whistles. Just speedometer and odometer mostly. It fits the bill just fine and looking forward to getting many thousands of miles out of it in the upcoming cycling season.
customer_reviews.author: Kirt Krause

customer_reviews.title: A good, simple, and easy to use cycling computer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an eighteen year-old CatEye that still worked, but I was having problems reading without eyeglasses as my vision changes with age. The Velo 7 has a big easy-to-read-display, and it's easy to cycle through (no pun intended) all of your basic ride information. The sensor system was a little difficult to mount because of the shape of my front fork, but I eventually secured the sensor. No complaints after 400 miles of use thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: So far, works great!
customer_reviews.text: I like this computer, even wired, as the other one I had before, wireless. Worked for two or three 25-mile rides and then quit. It was by Inbiking, by the way, and I did finally get reimbursed for the money I paid for it. One worked. One didn’t from Inbike. So I’m very satisfied with this one, husband had no issues putting it on my bike for me.
customer_reviews.author: csiss

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bike Speedometer
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this bike computer/speedometer. I purposely purchased the wired variety and found it to be very easy to install and set up. It's easy to read in bright sunlight and easily resets after each ride, except for the odometer which keeps a running total of all miles ridden until you want to reset that function as well. I'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Birder

customer_reviews.title: Don't Be Afraid, It's Easy to Set-Up. If I Can Do It Anybody Can
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box it was very intimidating to see five square feet of paper instructions. After quelling my panic and taking a closer look I realized that there are picture directions that are easy to follow. The only worrisome part was getting the little round magnet within 3/16" of the sensor. I don't believe I got it that close, but it seems to be close enough because I am very excited to say the computer--odometer works. The computer part is easy to remove and put in your pocket if you don't want to leave it on your parked bike. I am very excited to finally know how far I am biking.
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: Instructions and clock issue
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were confusing because I first tried "reading" the picture section. I needed to read old fashioned instructions and once I found them, it all made sense. So duh on my part. I could not get the clock to set a time and I finally found out what I was doing wrong by watching a video on the internet. What I was doing was pushing "set" right after I chose a 12 hour clock. You have to choose the 12, push mode and then set the clock. Don't push "set" until you're completely finished. Everything else about the little gadget is wonderful. Had the instructions been kinder to me, I would have given it a 5.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Good standard computer, seems to last well.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, basic wired computer. It gives all the info I need; distance, duration, speed, average speed, and max. I have two on different bikes, and they seem consistent and accurate. Really, no complaints, and decent for the price. If you're a recreational rider, or even if you're training fairly seriously, they do the job, and have been durable. My first one is nearly 2 years old, and still works with the original battery.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Bedini

customer_reviews.title: Simple - Does what a bike computer needs to do
customer_reviews.text: Distance, Speed, and Time - what more do you really need. Simple, inexpensive, and easy. Good setup directions (multiple languages including english). I had a Cateye Wireless Micro. Too complicated and 2 batteries to maintain. Who needs it. This one works great. No backlight, but I don't ride at night - besides, at night you should be watching the road, not worrying about your average speed or comparing against your 2nd trip distance.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I'm 56 years old and an avid bike rider. I have had quite a few speedometers over the years. I bought this one for a bike I keep at work. ( water plant) It sits in the sun for sometimes up to two hours. This speedometer is the first one I have bought for under $50 that does not black out in the sun. Simple to program and use. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid, simple display for speed, distance, time.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and simple. I use this on my gravel bike. I use an Apple Watch for STRAVA, so no need for GPS or heart monitor, etc.. I don't have a power meter nor cadence sensor on the gravel bike and don't intend to get them for that bike. This does exactly what I need and I don't need to charge a battery nor worry about the battery (in fact, this just stays on the bike). Simple speed, time, distance displays. Might get the outfront bracket later as an improvement (but that is almost as much as the VELO 7).
customer_reviews.author: Candoris

customer_reviews.title: Great Simple product
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product and recommend it. My wife and I are casual bike riders and needed something simple to give us an odometer and this product does it. You know when it's working from the icon blinking and stops when you stop, how simple is that. Thanks to all the YouTubers for a little help on the installation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Installed and working well on Trek Jet 16 Youth Bicycle
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son who wanted to be able to keep track of his speed and distance ridden. This was installed without issue on a Trek Jet 16. The exact tire size wasn't in the manual, so I followed the instructions to measure and determine the wheel circumference. My son enjoys seeing his riding stats and the speedometer has held up well to his use.
customer_reviews.author: William J

customer_reviews.title: Good entry level bike computer
customer_reviews.text: If you're just looking for something to track mileage, and speed - this works great! I was looking for something inexpensive to help me with my training for a cycling event. It can have issues if subjected to a lot of rain though...I got caught in a rainstorm once and it messed up the bike computer for a while. It would report inaccurate mileage. I'm not sure what I did but eventually, I managed to reset it to report something more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: High quality product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to mount and has nice large display that is easy to read. This is an actual quality product unlike the flood of cheap Chinese garbage trying to win the race to the bottom and make the lowest quality product that people will still pay for. Cause apparently that's what the masses want these days...
customer_reviews.author: Dan Lindquist

customer_reviews.title: Good, but...
customer_reviews.text: The unit performs as advertised and does a good job for me as a biker. Like both the quantity of data and ease of access. Only difficulty was setting the thing up. Instructions are of little use and virtually incomprehensible. But you can get it done with patience and trial and error.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Needs a better Mounting bracket
customer_reviews.text: The Cyclometer works fine but pops off the handle bracket to easily. lost one on the road and am always re-securing it when its half out of the bracket mount. Have this on three bikes they all do the same thing. Also contacts seem to loose their connection easily to small amounts of oxide and have to be constantly cleaned. Velo you can do better!
customer_reviews.author: P. Lutzi

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to set up and to read while pedaling.
customer_reviews.text: I like the display size and the ease of changing through screens. It was easy to set up with good instructions. I use it mostly to let my granddaughter know how many miles we put on for a given morning ride. I don't have to take a watch with me as the time is also noted on a display. Very good unit and has been flawless for months of use. I am glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: fritz at O.C.

customer_reviews.title: Holding device to handlebar is sub par
customer_reviews.text: The device appears to be relatively good. The materials used to hold the device to the handlebar leaves much to be desired. The using of miniature plastic pull straps to hold it in place is almost an insult to be perfectly honest. After one ride, they had already slid out of place. They can do much better.
customer_reviews.author: Sutiikare

customer_reviews.title: Works well but cheated on the length of wire
customer_reviews.text: This works well. Display is easy to read even in the sun. This gives me everything I need: speed is always shown, press the button to toggle through trip, odometer, max, average, time and clock. I do miss the temperature my last one had but not a deal breaker. What is an issue though is why on earth did they skimp on the length of the wire? I just made it work on my bike but I am limited to where it is located on the handlebar. Give me a break, it couldn't be costing them that much to include just 6 more inches of wire!
customer_reviews.author: Steve and Amy

customer_reviews.title: Most Amazing Customer Service I've ever seen!
customer_reviews.text: This CatEye Velo 7 Wired Bike Computer is everything that I could ask for in a speedometer/odometer. Appears to be very well made, easy to mount, and also easy to operate. Really, an amazing value. There was a bit of a snafu in the delivery of this product. It was NO fault of the seller, NetRush, but their customer service went way above and beyond what would be expected to make everything right. Pretty amazing to see such immediate concern and service, no question asked. I will definitely turn to NetRush for future needs, and I'd highly recommend you also deal with such fine folks.
customer_reviews.author: Just Dave

customer_reviews.title: great unit while it was working
customer_reviews.text: 1. Instructions very difficult to understand. I had to go to youtune to figure out how to set it up. 2.Once installed it worked to my expectations: a. odometer was very accurate b. speed was nice to see c.trip time good feature d. reset was easy. 3. After 3 weeks of use the unit failed to work. Will return it for another identical unit. Hope I have better luck with replacement.
customer_reviews.author: quaker 68

customer_reviews.title: Great computer, crappy mounting system
customer_reviews.text: It's a great computer, with all the things you need. Easy to read, about as easy as you can to program it. But you mount the computer on the handlebars with 2 thin zip ties. They tend to stretch out after a while and it slips around. It can get knocked around if throwing your bike in the back of a pickup or your hatchback. Too bad they chose this method for a great computer.
customer_reviews.author: Tomazzzo

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I only use the mileage, average speed, and time/elapsed time. Has several other functions that are not especially intuitive. Third one. Was able to salvage second one. They seem to last about 2-3 years (say about 4K-6K miles, for me). Generally, simple, light, battery life seems good. Last one was having problems connecting between sensor on fork and head unit.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying the information provided
customer_reviews.text: We had ordered another brand before but couldn't get it to work. After returning it, we replaced it with this one. Easy to install and it worked right away. Easy to read and fun to have on the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Woman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bike Computer
customer_reviews.text: What a pleasure to finally find a bike computer with only the necessary functions for riding. Time, distance, MPH! Simple to install and easy to read and scroll through the screens. The instructions are excellent. If you've toiled with a bike computer that needs an engineering degree to operate, chuck it in the bin and get the Velo. It's great.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Solved the “set time” challenge..quality product
customer_reviews.text: Took 30 minutes to set up, set up of clock took a few attempts figured out you have to hold “mode” to set hours and minutes..instructions are all diagrams. So far so good had to use a few extra zip ties be sure to follow bracket instructions carefully for easy on and off.
customer_reviews.author: DonCee

customer_reviews.title: Magnet counter not very strong
customer_reviews.text: Display is easy to read, and is easy to install. However, the speed is choppy when I go up hill or hit a bump. Have used on two rides and both times my speed would cut in half as if it were miscounting (i.e. 20 to 10, then back). I think the magnet is not strong enough so it occasionally miscounts RPM. This in turn affects my average speed and overall trip slightly, which is a bit of a nuisance. I will use this one, but will most likely buy a different one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Owned this for several years now and used it one two different sized bicycles. Very impressed on its reliability and low maintenance since the only thing I have ever done is change the batteries. Note I am note an avid bicyclists by no means but this unit serves me very well keeping track of my speed and distance.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Doty

customer_reviews.title: Great brand and great unit
customer_reviews.text: I have another Cateye on another bike that’s well over 10 years old and works perfectly. This unit looks at least as good. Accuracy is dead on. Easy to use and install.
customer_reviews.author: Rgbgt

customer_reviews.title: I can't set it up!
customer_reviews.text: I am using 3 Cat Eye Computers on 3 different bikes at this time. All work well. This Velo 7 will not set up. Perhaps I don't understand the directions. I stay with Cat Eye because I don't have trouble with them. Until now. I'll try to return it and get another model.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little cyclocomputer.
customer_reviews.text: This model does everything I need it to in a compact design. I, like other reviewers, love the large font. The sensor mounting is easy as is the unit itself. I compared the legitimacy of the ODO to my phone GPS and my Garmin GPS. I also compared it via rollout with the "wheel of fortune". Accuracy is within 0.02mi. Good enough for me! I am really glad I purchased this Cateye device. I am now a Cateye guy!
customer_reviews.author: R. Ilano

customer_reviews.title: Worst Bike Computer!
customer_reviews.text: The pros for this computer-easy installation and setup, multiple functions and accuracy to 1% of GPS are totally wiped out by the fact that the display is UNREADABLE with polarized glasses. This was a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: alk

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, only if it worked
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviews and expected it to be huge, the size is great! About the size of a tic tax box. Unfortunately, it doesn’t register my mileage or time. It turns on, but once you start pedaling the screen doesn’t change numbers. Wish I could get my money back :(
customer_reviews.author: NursesNummies

customer_reviews.title: How far have you gone today?
customer_reviews.text: I am a 84 year old and ride my bike daily during the summer. I am happy to say 10 miles on alternate days is a great physical workout. My son put it on and I love it. I can tell how far I have gone biking. Perfect for me. Thank u
customer_reviews.author: Diane Haubert

customer_reviews.title: Great 7 Function Cycling Computer
customer_reviews.text: For the money, you won't beat this cycling computer from a name brand manufacturer. Easy to set up, once you unfold the map-sized instructions. Matched up perfectly with my GPS readings, so accuracy seems to be spot on, once you go through the setup. Take the time to wrap the cable around your front brake line and leave enough slack at the bottom to not bind. Test fit with one of the included zip ties before you use the sticky backing. They give you extra zip ties and extra 3m tape for any mistakes. Good, quality, well thought out product will provide you with years of basic information.
customer_reviews.author: Bob R.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy!
customer_reviews.text: I have been riding with this bike computer for a few years now, and just recently bought my partner the same one. It's efficient, easy to use, easy to read, durable, and no nonsense. I imagine you can spend hundreds on expensive wireless systems that connect to multiple devices and read out everything from your heart rate to your thoughts – but if you want something simple and dependable, this is it. I have ridden in rain and snow, I have left my bike out in -11 degree weather – this thing takes a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Julien

customer_reviews.title: Always great when something works the way it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: First tried a vey popular and highly rated wireless odometer but had battery and or transmitting issues so gave up. The Velo 7 is wired and has only one battery. Installation is pretty straight forward and intuitive if you take your time. The instructions for setting up the correct tire size are a tad confusing. If you go to their web site they are more clear IMHO. Have just taken one 20 minute ride and it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Pat & Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Works like supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Installed this and it is easy to see and install. I think the mileage and accuracy work fine. Good product
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy setup, and it just works
customer_reviews.text: Setup was very quick and easy (would've been even quicker if I didn't spend the time trying to make it look as neat as possible.) The included instructions are easy to follow, and as far as I can tell, the speed and distance are pretty accurate once you have your wheel/tire size set up correctly. The readings matched what Google Maps said on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Works well on a mountain bike
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Has all the data I need without being ridiculously over techy. Some complained that they couldn’t adjust the sensor close enough the magnet. I’ve mounted the sensor on my mountain bike shocks. The clearance is about 2X the recommended distance and it still works fine. Just make sure you mount the sensor on the opposite side of the brake disc. I compared it to a GPS and it’s close enough for my use
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Hell of a deal!
customer_reviews.text: I don't think you can beat this for the price. Beg easy to read face. Give the basic info you want.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Finally a bike computer for the average user
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a review of two of these devices. I originally got a different device for my wife and was disappointed with how complicated it was. Neither one of wants all that information. When I saw this one, I bought it and after using it for a day, bought a second one for my wife. Very simple to set up and even simpler to use. Unless you absolutely have to have a unit that gives you 24 or more bits of info...(only after pressing a number of buttons a number of times)...this is the one for you!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Weak Magnet
customer_reviews.text: The magnet doesn't have a strong enough pull for those who have wide forks found on mountain bikes or even shock absorbers. If you have shocks and or even worse, adjustable shocks the magnet will not pull enough to get a good signal. I suggest the manufacturer using Rare Earth magnet of a tad bit larger size to get a much stronger pull.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: not so happy with the instructions when interpretation of centimeters is what ...
customer_reviews.text: I appreciated the simple design and operation of the cateye 7, not so happy with the instructions when interpretation of centimeters is what you have to go by. In other words, the placement of the Hall effect switch ( sensor ) would have been easier for me in inches not CM. The unit works but unsure if accurate. Brush up on your metrics before installation, the test will take place during the install...............
customer_reviews.author: Dave M.

customer_reviews.title: Large font display, tough unit
customer_reviews.text: I've used the whole series of cats eye speedo tough and reliable not a lot of batteries to change .great display the would be with polarized glasses which still work with a roll of the head . Recommend to all . Nice large display.
customer_reviews.author: Hans K.

customer_reviews.title: Listing is misleading,
customer_reviews.text: The listing says "CAT EYE - Velo 7 Bike Computer - Speedometer and Odometer - Optional Headlight and Tail Light" There is no Headlight or Tail Light. Computer is easy to install and setup, if you download the instructions from the website. Suggest you change the wording on the listing. Words mean things.
customer_reviews.author: Al Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is you can't see time elapsed AND distance traveled on one screen. Otherwise it seem accurate and is easily visible on even the brightest days. I love that it only counts time when you're actually moving, and uses that to calculate average speed.
customer_reviews.author: T. R. Zimmer

customer_reviews.title: It works,
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to carry over my miles from my old Odometer from last year, That was a pain to set, I felt like " Are you smarter then a 5th grader". After getting all the numbers in the Odometer works good and I like I do not have to worry about the wireless not working like my last Odometer stopped.
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyS66

customer_reviews.title: Not for multiple bikes since difficult to change settings
customer_reviews.text: If you want to use this on multiple bikes with different based, it takes time to reset your settings. Also I got mine from Europe and was asked to pay for my international shipping when I wanted to return.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mc

customer_reviews.title: Perfect adjunct to my handlebar-mounted phone.
customer_reviews.text: The display is very clear and the speed readout is large and easy to see. Setup is simple, however, am unable to fine tune the circumference of my tire in millimeters but their default lookup table is pretty accurate.
customer_reviews.author: D'King

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and set up, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of good things to say about this computer. It installs easily. (Note that I have installed at least three CayEyes over the years, and they haven't changed a great deal in terms of installation.) The characters are large and easy to read. It is simple to work. Set up isn't too difficult, although in general, the limited controls on bike computers always make the process less than intuitive. On the other hand, the directions are clear and easy to read, making set up painless. Once the computer is installed and set up, it is very simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Neece

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt last.
customer_reviews.text: Setup is easy, the computer works great. Only gripe is that it should come with more zipties. I had to change my review. The setup is easy and it worked great for about 5 months, then stopped working. Replacing the battery and trying resets didnt work. No display or anything, just stopped working. Cant recommend at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very sensative to low speed
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice looking unit that functions within acceptable parameters. That being said, I would have expected it to be able to record slower speeds than 2.4 mph. No matter how much I adjusted the magnet relative to the pick-up it wouldn't record below 2.4 mph. This being a wired unit, I would have expected it to be at least as sensitive as my wireless unit on my road bike.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Harkins

customer_reviews.title: Good battery life, hard to read or use.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a UI designer and I’ve owned a handful of these little computers over the past decade. This one is the hardest to use and has the worst layout. Absolutely the beat battery life and on the bike much easier to install. It’s also far better looking then it’s competitio.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Z.

customer_reviews.title: Wired unit will only reach front wheel and not for use with a trainer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit to use with my trainer. I returned it soon after opening the package and realized that the wire was too short to place sensor on the rear wheel. I have since ordered a wireless unit costing twice as much
customer_reviews.author: PopPop Bray

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This was for my moms three wheeled Bike. She really likes it! I had to modify mounting to make it fit and work. Her bike had wide plastic spokes and the sensor mounting was for skinny metal spokes.
customer_reviews.author: redchevy

customer_reviews.title: Really pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Biking is a lot more fun when I can check my speed, mileage, average speed, max speed. After 335 miles, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: A4WES

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to setup, so far no problems with rain
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I was a little worried about using it in the rain, but its been in the rain and its works with no problem. I bought this one vs. a wireless one because I don't want to have to worry about changing the battery in two places (on the wheel and on the computer itself). So, I bought this wired one. It was easy to install and setup. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fish

customer_reviews.title: Highly revommended.
customer_reviews.text: On Sep 2017 I purchased my Cateye velo 7 and to this day it is still in perfect condition, battery is still strong. I also love the clock. I highly recommend the wired Cat eye velo 7. What a great product.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: The reviews are absolutely right - Easy to install, set up, and operate.
customer_reviews.text: The reviews stated that it was easy to set up and use. They were right. I installed the mount, magnet and sensor in about 10 minutes. Getting the device programmed was a breeze. The instructions are Superb! Well written and very concise. (and printed on really large paper!) I am happy with the ease of operation as well. A single button does everything. I used the optional alternate tire diameter process to dial in the accuracy of the speedometer. The speed and distance match my GPS quite well. The larger numbers on the display are also a welcomed feature. I recommend this bike computer for any rider!
customer_reviews.author: RE-View

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and works great.
customer_reviews.text: The unit is very solidly constructed. I had another brand that was poorly constructed so that the wire into the computer was always coming loose and it stopped working. I was very please to see this is nor likely to happen with this computer. Also it is extremely easy and convent to use. A+++
customer_reviews.author: James H. Folz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, easy to operate, and works well. I have not had any issues with this little bike computer. It's nice to know how long you have been riding in both time and distance. Would definitely buy again as the price is right and it gives you every feature you actually want/need.
customer_reviews.author: J.W.

customer_reviews.title: Worthless after a few weeks!
customer_reviews.text: Works and reads very accurately. Tested it out for a few miles cleared and tested it again and again. Still playing with the settings but so far so good. Really enjoy this gadget. 3 weeks later: Completely stopped working 3 weeks after I installed it. Troubleshooting didn't work at all. Don't reccomend. Complete disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: JRA

product_meta.title: CAT EYE, Velo 7 Wired Bike Computer with Odometer and Speedometer
product_meta.description: The newly designed Velo 7 is CatEye's entry level 7 function computer. The larger screen is even easier to read and set up is made simple with pre-programmed tire sizes. Battery life up to three years. Weighs 28g.
feature_bullets: ALL YOUR FAVORITE STATS: Displays current, max, and average speed, total distance, trip distance, elapsed time, pace arrow, and clock.

DON'T SWEAT THE SMALL STOPS: Caught at a red light? Stopping for coffee? We've got you covered. Your CatEye computer knows when you've stopped and automatically stops counting time and averaging speed.
WIRED SENSOR: The Velo 7 comes with a wired speed sensor.
GO THE DISTANCE: With a battery that lasts up to three years, you can install it and forget about it.
PERFECT FOR BEGINNERS: The Velo 7 is an entry-level computer that is perfect for beginner cyclists looking to take their riding to the next level.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
